intro: Hieracium pinegense, commonly known as the alpine hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky areas, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Hieracium pinegense is often found at elevations above 1,500 meters, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil in harsh environments.
